oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Using teat endoscopy (theloscopy) to diagnose and treat milk flow disorders in cows
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Geishauser, Thomas
Querengasser, Klaus
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: cows
dairy cattle
diagnostic techniques
endoscopy
teat diseases
teats
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Theloscopy or endoscopic examination of the teat is used to diagnose milk flow disorders, visualize the cistern during surgery and monitor teat response to treatment. This article describes the procedure and equipment used for theloscopy of the bovine teat.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: The Bovine Practitioner; Vol. 35, No. 2 (2001 June); 156-164
